review_title: Brilliant Spy Themed Escape Room Game!
one_reviews_text: Even though this is quite an old game it is really fun to play and quite challenging, requiring a lot of lateral thinking and improvisation. It is a Bond themed game, but I imagine it would be fun even if you are not into the spy genre. The only reason I gave it four stars instead of five is because there is no way to rotate your view using the controllers with an Oculus headset and I play in a very tight space with limited mobility. This meant it was very difficult and quite painful to try to twist around so I could access items that were just behind me. I don't imagine it is likely they will add such a feature, but I am sure many people would appreciate it. I was also unable to reset my progress so that someone else could play the game from the start without uninstalling and re-installing it. That said it is a really good game and for the price I would definitely recommend it - if you have space to sit on a swivel chair and rotate then it will be an even better experience. And you should expect to die many times! It was hilarious just how many ways there were to die, and I laughed out loud each time...

review_title: Clever, witty, and now I want more!
one_reviews_text:
I purchased this after seeing the reviews, watching a couple videos and I was curious to see how it was. I was definitely not disappointed. 

In the role of a spy-agent, you're tasked with completing various puzzles, heavily reminiscant of escape rooms (which is what it basically is), trying to complete various situations.... while trying not to die. Emphasis on trying. 

While there were definitely some points where I felt frustrated at having to start the level all over again (which is what happens when you die), the length of each level is arguably perfect, being not too short that you feel like it's over before it began, but long enough that when you die it's not the worst feeling to start all over again. 

Not only that, the levels are constructed in such a way that they often make you leave a scenario feeling 'cleverer' than when you started, and it's a rewarding experience. 

From start to finish, it took around 2-3 hours to complete. For the price and the experience, I would say that would be about what I expect to pay, if not more. I've not really had the ability to compare a game to a real life activity, but comparatively, if you compare the cost of this with a real life escape room, a 2-person escape room for 1hr down the road costs $84 AUD, and I would argue this is a lot more fun and lasts longer! 

There is additional replayability with a achievement system, called 'souvenirs', and dev comments become available after the first complete run through. 

I would highly recommend this game to anyone looking for a light-hearted VR puzzle type challenge.

Even before you get into the actual game, it's fun just picking up things in the office and doing things to/with them -- Which leads to the other big plus: It has the best, and most quickly intuitive, control scheme of any VR game I've played. The ability to pick up things that are out of your physical reach and "pull" them to you, along with the "ghosted outline" for objects that are behind/under other objects is simply genius. I've played other games (that I otherwise liked) that became frustrating because an object fell or rolled just out of reach, or dropped behind another object.

Another big plus for me personally, is that it really can be played seated (which unfortunately is an absolute requirement for me). Some other games that list as being playable while sitting either require you to be able to swivel around (like in an office chair) or stand up occasionally to reach/grab some items -- neither of which is an option for me. Admittedly, I'm probably in a very tiny minority of players in that regard, but your game plays so flawlessly while seated that it makes we wish that some of the other games that *almost* work seated could take a lesson from you.

Next up, the gameplay itself. I love a good puzzle game, and at their core, that's what the missions actually are: puzzles. Puzzles wrapped up inside a very cool spy theme, and puzzles where you have to die (repeatedly) in order to figure them out -- Which brings me to another plus. Dying is fun. There are so many entertaining ways to die, and it's such an integral part of the game, that it (almost) never becomes frustrating.

Some honourable mentions: The fully immersive "feel" of the environment. The incredible attention to detail. Having multiple solutions to many obstacles. Adding items to the office as you complete missions. The voice that talks you through all the missions (who is great, by the way). That INCREDIBLE opening sequence and fantastic theme song. Everything. Seriously, everything.

one_reviews_text: Definitely a must-buy for puzzle lovers.  Probably the best sitting touch control game I've played.  Excellent humor and puzzles wrapped in a secret agent aesthetic.  I played through the whole game in one sitting… Which is my only complaint, that I didn’t get enough right after I got addicted. I’m hoping the developer takes what they learned making this and make some additional magic for us to experience. I’ll keep an eye on them.
One of my favorite VR games. But sadly to short and no replay motivation.
Fantastic game, ideal for people without much space to use VR in. but it feels like a demo, there are only 4 levels. For the price I would expect double that, hopefully more will come one day.

A well developed and thought out series of challenges oozing with flavor, like a spy-themed virtual escape room. With a wonderful spash of humor and a handful of ways to approach each challenge, as well as a smattering of achievements, this is a fantastic title to use to show off what VR is all about. Only draw back? So darn short. Can be polished off inside 2 hours, and will leave you wanting so much more.
Fun but way 2 short.
Amazing game, way too short. Save your money for a sale or wait until they release new levels later in 2017.

It's a puzzle / escape game in which you must save day or escape. There are 4 puzzles and multiple ways to solve them, a lot of humor and fun interactions. The musics are great too ! I don't know if I would pay full price for it, but I do not regret playing it !

review_title: Well made and fun, but short
one_reviews_text: The game has very fun setting, cool gameplay mechanics, but lacks of good narative and length.

It's very, very, very short. It's only six missions long so do yourself a favour and don't watch a single Let's Play. Just buy the game if you want a great VR experience but keep in mind it's less than two hours long.

This game is pretty good! It has an awesome and funny atmosphere and the puzzles are (while maybe a little easy) very engaging. Only con I have is that it is a little short. That said I hope we get a sequel!
Awsome game, great humor, and awesome fun gadgets! Can't wait for more!
More games like this please. I had a blast.

review_title: Great escape room with a spy theme
one_reviews_text: First of all, yes it's short, something you can do in one or two evenings.  BUT!!!  It's just freaking cool, lots of replayability with souveneirs and easter eggs, good replay by showing friends and stuff, love it, super cool
Great aktion puzzle game with 007 charme

An essential VR game that gets across why virtual reality is so fundamentally different from traditional games. It immerses you in Schell’s take on spy culture, and provides some frantic heart pounding moments as you try not to die. The adventure is over all too quickly, but the format of the missions being launched from a central office is the perfect platform to bring in additional missions as updates or DLC, which I would wholly support if they matched up to the impeccable quality of the existing puzzles.
Its a cool experience but way too short for the price. Get it on sale.
smoke weed everyday

I realy liked this game, what a great experience, we really feel like a secret agent. Touch works perfectly and puzzle are very good, very natural and logic. Only problem: the time you play vs the price.15$ would have been a better price. Other game like Wilson's heart are not much more expensive but are longer and always fun too.

review_title: Good but way too short for the price
one_reviews_text: Way too short for the price, especially if you're good at puzzles and finish it quick. Needs a free expansion to make up for the price or a cheap expansion with many more levels. I'd say wait for a sale until you buy this.
This game is ok. Graphics are kinda cool. Not a game that has any action if thats what your looking for. Cool to play a couple times. Other than that it's a waist of money.
great artistic design and humor,

A $25 game that is only 2 hours long, and the creators went on to say they would be expanding the game, and would make users pay for this expansion. the game only comes with 4 levels and is at best a $10 game. Do not waste your time till it comes on sale.

review_title: Great fun, but like usual, super short
one_reviews_text: This was fun for less than the hour that it lasted.  These VR games are not worth the price they are charging for as little content as they deliver. About, 50 cents a minute, but it was fun while it lasted.
Very short but a great game. Don't pass it up!
This game should only be sold for $15, max. It is so good, but way too short, especially with virtually no replayability.

review_title: By Far the most fun I have had in VR
one_reviews_text: One of the best games I've ever played, VR or non-VR. This is a great game with many different ways to solve problems. I love everything about it. Only downside would be that it is too short. I use this game to show people how awesome VR can be.

It only took me maybe 3 hours to beat this game, but the quality of those 3 hours makes it worth the money. There's a lot of charm and the levels are very clever and make great use of VR. There are also achievements to get that may take you some time to figure out (I'm still working on them).

Who doesn't want to feel like James Bond escaping a submarine? And then feel like a total BAMF sitting in someone elses office, wearing their hat, smoking their cigars, drinking their whiskey and lighting their taxidermy bear on fire. The missions really make you think, and die, and think harder and die, then realize what you were actually supposed to do and die again, before you complete the level. It is great fun!

but it's also super short. Like, SUPER short. And it wasn't too challenging. But the production quality is very nice. 
But you'll only play through it once, and I don't think any game that takes 1-3 hours to play through one time is worth more than $10, and the realization that it was already over was pretty aggravating.
For a 25 USD u'll get only 4 short levels. That's all you need to know about this "game".

Great change of pace VR game for when you get tired of shooting stuff. Don't cheat and look up the answers. The puzzels aren't very hard - you can generally exhaust all possible approaches to find the solution just by attempting the level multiple times.

The presentation of this game is perfect. The opening credits alone had me smiling. The only bad thing is that there are only four missions! Normally I would say the game isn't worth the money for the very short experience. However the presentation value is so high here that it may be worth it if you want to splurge a little. Hopefully the devs update the game with more content.

The puzzles in this game may not be groundbreaking, but exploring your surroundings to find the solution is so much fun. Unfortunately, this can be beaten rather quickly in its current state (there are only 4 missions). That being said, everyone I've shown it to has enjoyed it, and wanted to play it all the through in one sitting.
Very cool, funny, and good looking. But, it's a bit repetitive. Then again, so is any room escape game. This is the best one of that genre.

I'm really enjoying the Touch controls on this game.  I can comfortable play while sitting at my desk.  If something is below my desk I can point at it and pull it in.  This makes it so I dont have to have camera coverage under my desk to play the game.  The game is funny.  I like the cheese bond references.

This is awesome VR experience. The designers really took their time to figure out how to make this an accessible, comfortable, and fun experience with seated VR. With the Oculus Touch controllers, everything felt natural so quickly. The only thing that was slightly unusual was in the control scheme for "pulling" an item to you, but you do figure it out after some trial and error.

That said, the quality of this game is outstanding. The environments are great, the puzzles are fun and enjoyable, and the voice acting and polish are terrific. This is the game I get everyone to try after the Oculus intro, because it's so interactive and easy to get into. People are laughing and get fully immersed into VR so quickly in this game. I really hope they come out with a Sequel!

I'd like to give it four stars, simply because it needed about two more levels to feel complete - it was just a bit too short and I was ready for a final tough mission, when I realized that it was over instead. But compared to most all the other "tech demos" out there for VR, this is by far one of the top VR titles, so 5 stars it is! Make another one guys!
Nice James Bond vibe. Simple and fun puzzles. Short, so well worth your time.

the game is fun. i wish there were a few more missions (i finished it in one night). the only times i got stuck on puzzles were when i wasn't reading instructions properly (stupid me). the game itself worked very well except every now and then my view would shift a bit. absolutly worth a play
I really enjoyed this game and would play it for days. Too bad the game only lasts a few hours, but it's early on for VR games, and I'm sure there will be more like it.

Only giving a 5* because I enjoyed the game so much. I strongly recommend NOT to watch any gameplays on YouTube and NOT to look for hints on internet. Game is very short and puzzles are easy to solve. One warning, though! Once you are familiar with all 4 levels, you can speedrun through entire game within like 5-10 minutes!!! Even first walkthrough won't take you more than 1-2 hours!!! Game really IS short.

I loved this game. It's beautifully conceived and executed from the opening credits through to the situations you have to escape from. It's a perfect VR game. However, and it's a big however, it's really short. I probably got a couple of hours out of it including a few replays. It's possible to finish the game in ten minutes from start to finish. I would also say the puzzles were a bit too easy.

I like the idea of trying to solve a puzzle with your hands, while sitting down. Technically it works really well, but the levels are too fiddly and what to do is not alway immediately obvious. This means that you're not going to get your 78-year-old father into VR by showing him this. James Bond simulator this is not.

review_title: Love it. This is what I dream of for VR.
one_reviews_text: I wish there were more levels but this was amazingly fun. I appreciate that it wasnt too easy like most of these types of games. I cannot wait for addtional content.
I loved the gameplay. The puzzle aspect is also very fun. Best mission in my opinion is the submarine mission. Definetly recommended.
This is hands down my favorite experience on the rift. Feels like you are in one of the No one lives forever games! Just wish there were more levels.

I thoroughly enjoyed this game, I started playing it before i got the touch and it was ok, but now that i have the touch controllers it is amazing. Having to solve problems under pressure and improvise on the go, really fun. I highly recommend this for people who like puzzle games.

Probably one of my favourite games out there right now, this is a clever, fun, and witty game. The puzzles are complex, friends keep surprising me with different ways to complete them, and I have hours of fun trying to get all the achievements. My one gripe is that it needs some more levels, but hopefully the devs will keep those coming.
Buy while on sale. Can be beaten in less than an hour.

review_title: I got to be a spy for a day.
one_reviews_text: The puzzles really challenge your noggin...
Great little game..... needs alot more levels though as completed in six hours

review_title: Oculus store is full of extreme ratings
one_reviews_text:
Either you deify an app or you hate it. Owed to these extremes this game which is clearly worth 5 stars and the money spent, won't stick out between the rest.
Formatting of the revisions is crap, so I spare you my formatted review. Buy it, is on one level with Super Hot.
As the title says. to put it short, there is only 4-5 scenarios/Levels to do. it needs more levels

review_title: Short, but VR at its best.
one_reviews_text: The game is short, but it really highlights what a VR game can be. There are not many levels, but each one has some great puzzles that require the player to interact with everything in the room. There are some easter eggs and some achievements that help extend the replay value. This is also a great introduction to VR for new players. I wish there was more content, but I still recommend it.

review_title: Love it, but it's so short!
one_reviews_text:
Like most VR titles at the moment, this is simply far, far too short. It's essentially a series of 4-5 short VR escape rooms of about 10-15 minutes each. Given repeat attempts (since you are all but guaranteed to die a couple times per room) you get maybe 2-3 hours of gameplay for the price.

But here's the thing... like Super Hot, the content that is here is so good, that it leaves you wanting more. So while there is definitely too little content, the content that is there is fantastic.

*Devs: SQUID BATTLE! Or just more puzzles/DLC? 

Though only carrying a couple of levels, the replay-ability is high with trying to accomplish objectives that win you "souvenirs" to take back. Commentary button is unlocked at the end so you replay the game and see the work put into the levels you just had a blast solving. Easy to play with Touch controllers, satisfying to beat each escape room and plenty of small hidden mechanics to enjoy. Worthy purchase for sure, hope to see more from this studio!

review_title: Great example of VR, but too short
one_reviews_text: I'm glad I got this on sale, because the included levels are not enough for the full price (I'd argue they're not enough for the discounted price either). The demo for this game was hands down the best VR experience available, and while addition of touch integration is welcome, it's a shame that the equivelent level is basically identical and there are so few additional levels . I hope that more will be added in future (maybe a yacht and penthouse? :p). It might make the game replayable if you add goals to die in every possible way for each level, as well as the souvenirs.

I really enjoyed this game, it was well thought out and fun. However it wasn't very hard at all and I don't consider myself very good at puzzle games. I also wasn't expecting to beat a $25 game in less then 24 hours after I bought it. All in all I might have put a solid 3 hours in to this before finishing.  Not sure how this was consider finished and worth $25.

Great controls make it easy to pick up and play. With an enjoyable script, great puzzles and excellent cartoon visuals this is the go-to game to demonstrate VR to friends and family.

Game is admitedly short and there's some achievement things for each puzzle which I'll be going through. Don't let this be a reason to pass on the game though.

review_title: This is awesome, but I need more!
one_reviews_text:
*Hey you, developer at Schell games, add some squid fights :p*
This is an "escape the room" puzzle game in a James Bond-esque *espionage* setting, with a lot of humour! It's very charming. The gameplay with Touch is awesome, and that's probably why this game in on the touch launch bundle.

The only really thing that this game needs is more missions. I really hope that the developpers will continue to update it and add a bit more content. 

The openning sequence is jaw dropping, a real work of art, and I can't recomend this game enough!

This is probably my favorite VR game so far.  I love the details like being able to light the cigars and the telekinetic ability is a delight and a must for all future seated titles.  I can't tell you enough how wonderful telekinesis is when you have a smaller play area and this developer really nailed it.  And while the game IS short, there is some replayability with the secret challenges each level has.  I'd love it if there were a local and global leaderboard for challenges and speed runs.
I really hope this developer makes many more games like this or for VR in general.  I'll have my eye on them.

Nice game, unfortunately only a few levels. Would love them to come around with more!
How ever, it was worth the money.
It's done well and all but for the price there isn't much. Once you finish it all (which doesn't take very long) I don't see any reason to play it again...

This is a great puzzle game, especially with the touch controllers. I really enjoyed the imaginative content. My main problem is just how little content there is. A few levels and the game is over. Sure, they are great levels and well designed. But you can easily finish this game in about 3 hours playing it casually. This game needs more content or a less expensive price.

The puzzles were well thought out and entertaining. I was only stumped for a few moments on each and eventually got by them all. I look forward to playing them again to get the speed runs and additional achievements. Looking forward to more puzzles or a sequel.

review_title: Fun in the vein of Esper2
one_reviews_text: This game reminds me quite a bit of Esper2 as far as its overall humor and puzzle focus. But while esper's ball-and-block puzzles eventually started to get a bit stale by the end, I Expect You to Die stays fresh for each mission.  The unfortunate part is that it is rather short at only 4 missions.  However, the entire experience is very well polished and there's some replayability in the easter eggs and achievements. I'm very much looking forward to the follow up game to this.  Another note: beating this game unlocks developer commentary bubbles similar to portal 2, which I found very entertaining and interesting.

review_title: Great experience, but way too short
one_reviews_text:
The game, it's visual, it's lvl designs, it's funny narative direction are top quality for a VR game.
Every puzzle are fun to solve and you need some quick thinking after a choice you make.

But the game is 4 lvl long!!!!!! Based on the achievment, you can finish the game in less than 15 minutes!!! I finish it in less than a hour and I was really bad at the 3 lvl.
I'm happy I bought the game on sale. If I payed it full price on steam, I will have asked for a refound.
Don't buy the game full price, wait for a 50% sale and have some fun.

review_title: A great experiment to be improved upon
one_reviews_text: An awesome experience that really shows what VR is capable of. Sure it could be a tad longer, and I'd like to be able to move around the room beyond just the size of my playspace, but this is a very polished puzzler that guides the way for future experiences in this vein.
Fun game. replay value is questionalbe but worth the price IMO.

review_title: Great Game, wish it was longer,
one_reviews_text:
This game has 4 levels in. If you're used to live escape rooms or puzzle games then that is an issue as it is quite short. 

I personally would find an extra room would make this game perfect for all those complaining.. four makes it feel too small and five just sounds like the right amount. 

This game is really fun though, and shines through in those moments you get stuck. Would play again one day once ive forgotten that the levels are like.

Its a very short fun game. Be ready to finish this game in 1.5 hours, but what you get in return is great entertainment with actual puzzle like scenarios. Picked it up in a bundle, but would still recommend purchasing it by itself. Sitting VR game which requires very little space due to a smart control system.
It's THE first VR game I've played that makes me completely enthralled by a world, that transform me into another person. It's the dawn of what VR will become.
This game is really using VR. It just feels natural. It is fun, sometimes relaxing, sometimes makes you feel pressurised (in a good and funny way) and has a great story and an awesome Intro.

It's a 'room' solving game that lacks the tactile interactivity of something like Job Simulator.  The environmental interactions can be amusing but the whole experience is highly limited, and the touch controllers are largely wasted here.  It's more experience than game, and it relies heavily on the novelty of being in VR to make up for it's lack of interesting content.

If I'd bought it on Steam I'd have gotten a refund, there's no way to get two hours out of this.

This is a puzzle game that is a very comfortable seated experience.  It works very well with my moderate size, 2-camera playing area, using the Touch controls.

This game simply shouts quality.  You play as a secret agent undertaking dangerous missions.  The opening sequence puts you inside a great Bond-like movie opening number, complete with a catchy atmospheric song.  Simply fantastic!

You get some simple training, familiarizing you with the simple and sensible controls and then jump into the first mission.  I was able to complete that first mission after several tries.  The puzzles are quite logical and I had a lot of fun working through them and dying several times.  I am already thrilled with this purchase after this one level.   Buy it!

Totally worth it. Really high quality visuals and great voice acting. Really fun, enjoyable experience. Yeah it's short, but I'll take an experience I'll fondly remember over a lesser purchase. If you enjoy solving puzzles at all, just get it now. I think you'll be please.
A thoroughly enjoyable puzzle game, but with only 5 missions, it's over too quickly.

Puzzles were hella cool. Played switching off with friends and it was cool to see how there was a few alternate solutions. More levels for the next one, maybe do some surprise levels past when the player expects the game to end. All and all telling friends to buy.
Great game, great fun. But way to short. i think, 10 rooms should be for your bucks. But anyway, a realy great experience
Needs to be longer, But it is one of the Better Games out there, Had fun completeing it would like to see more
Good challenging puzzles and nice calm use of touch, not very long but definitely worth it
The puzzles are clever, the humor is great & as a seated experience it's a welcome relief from the intense workout that touch enabled games often are.

review_title: A tad short, but still awesome
one_reviews_text: I first played a demo of this a few years ago on the original Oculus Rift development kit. The only control scheme available at the time were mouse controls, but even then it was still an awesome experience. The only playable level in the demo was the first level in the cargo plane. I couldn't wait until the final game released to play more levels. Now that this game is finally out, I absolutely love the touch controls. I beat the first level instantly because I already knew all of the steps, so the other levels were what I was looking forward to playing the most. Each level has the perfect amount of challenge and polish and they were all very well done. My only gripe is the total number of levels are very few (currently 4). I bought this game in a bundle and got it for relatively cheap, but I still feel the devs should update this with more levels to justify the full price. If you are looking for a solid gaming experience and aren't worried about the price-vs-gameplay-hours ratio, I highly recommend getting this. Otherwise, I would recommend getting this in a bundle or sale.
One of the must have VR games.

I absolutley love this game. The puzzles are challenging and so much fun. I love the humor. Honestly, if I could give this game more stars I would. Please give me more of this game! I would take DLC or a totally seperate title but I need more IEYtD puzzles. Thanks for the great game!

review_title: Great fun, but begging for more content
one_reviews_text:
Super-sweet and well thought out puzzles. Humour that actually works. Spy-film references that make you smile. Deep, rich and varied interactions throughout. Achievements for a little bit of replay value. There really is much to recommend here. Even a couple of missteps with the occasionally frustrating unclear puzzle, or clumsy interaction don't damage the experience.

Works brilliantly with touch, even if there's sometimes deadly ambiguity with closely overlapping hitzones. For example, why would I ever want to pull the pin on a grenade that I'm not holding?

There is a major cost to all this love and attention to detail however. Just four scenarios, one of which is virtually unchanged from the DK2 demo, simply isn't enough content for the amount being charged. The whole experience only lasted a couple of hours for me, and I generally consider myself pretty bad at escape-the-room games.

I first played this game a little over a year ago when I Expect You To Die was on Oculus Share. Immediately, it was one of my favorite games for VR and I showed all my friends. I've been waiting patiently since then for a full version, and boy was it worth the wait!

The mouse is a surprisingly good input device for this game, but I have to say, Oculus Touch really makes you feel like James Bond.

From the amazing original song and intro (a la James Bond) to the intricate predicaments you find yourself in, you'll quickly fall in love and want to be a super spy yourself.

Prepare for your future as a spy. Buy this game now.

This game deserves to be experienced if you prefer quality over quantity.

You'll read everywhere that's it's short, and it is. But there is so much polish in it, that it justifies the price tag in my eyes. The intro scene is just a VR masterpiece. The missions are fun, all different one from another and the puzzles are smart without being too hard.

If you're not judging a book by its size relative to its price, you're going to have a great time.

review_title: Amazing game... but it's too short.
one_reviews_text: The title really says it all. It's probably my favorite launch title for Touch but it's too short. I think a $10 or $15 price tag would have been more fitting. If they would have included 4 more levels it would have been an easy 5 stars.

I don't think I would have picked this up if it wasn't part of the Touch Launch Bundle, but I'm glad it was included - very fun! I do struggle with the scale, especially while seated. My play area is not that small, but I still find myself bumping into the boundaries - though this is avoidable if you make liberal use of the telekinesis ability.

review_title: A must-buy, but a bit short
one_reviews_text: An incredibly clever and fun game, that regretfully ends much too early. The content that is there is of the highest quality, however, and the puzzles are clever without becoming annoyingly difficuly. The different achievments and ways to solve puzzles makes it a joy to replay. Highly recommended.
This game gives you the option to skip the Opening Credits, don't!  It sets the tone of a classic Bond film beautifully.
All in all it's a good and fun game, but it's much too short for this price (Theres only 4 maps to play)!

Wonderful experence and game.  This game is fantastic.  You get to feel like you are 007 solving puzzles to escape impossible situations.  One of the more polished VR experences.  They really knocked this out of the park.  I only wish it had more levels and more extra's.  Like everyone else has said - takes around 2 hr to finish.  If you love puzzles and 007 this game is a must buy!  Seriously why are you still reading this review - go buy it!

If anyone wanted more of No One Lives Forever, this game takes that setting and plants you firmly into the pant suit of Ms. Archer once again, but in a room escape game. Wonderfully crafted and lovely portrayal of the characters.  However, I did want a little more for the current asking price (£18 GBP), suggesting £12 would have been a better start.

review_title: IEYTD is way too short for the price
one_reviews_text:
This game is incredibly fun and polished. The escape room idea translates well into VR when woven with a story like these are. It's clear the developers spent a lot of time on this game. The problem? When it came out on the other side there just wasn't that much there. 

$25 for a couple of hours of entertainment when there are $12-$15 games on the store that give ENDLESS replayability is pretty unacceptable. 

I feel the vast majority is willing to accept VR games as "demos" and "betas" and "ideas" because of it's infancy but we need to wake up. $12.50/hour for an experience, albeit as much fun as this one is, is a complete rip off. You spend a lot of time in this game burning money with lighters or in fire places, and when the credits rolled on this one I felt like I did just that. Burned my money.

review_title: A great little puzzler. But too short
one_reviews_text: The puzzles weren't too hard, though I felt a bit stumped a couple of times, but then I remembered that this is basically a point n click adventure and therefore a certain level of outside the box thinking is required. The only main thing I can complain about is what everyone else says. More levels please!

Yes a but short, but maybe they will release DLC with extra misisons. Touch support is great. Missions are fun and amuzing. I really recommend this game. Thanks devs for such a nice entertainment. Took me about 2:30-3:00 relaxing hours to finish the game.

review_title: A very well designed seated puzzle game
one_reviews_text: The controls work really well, the puzzles are entertaining and challenging, and the sense of presence is amazing. You really feel like 007 trying to escape a room, or solve a puzzle. This really is a must have. The only downside is that there's not more of it. Every level has "achievements" which requires you to really explore the level and all its possibilities.

I have to admit, I only got this game because it was included in the bundle.. am I glad I got it!!! I could not stop playing.. even replaying levels to get all achivements and try to beat the time. 

The game is well thought out, the puzzles are quite elaborate. 

I hope they could add more levels.
The gameplay and humor is absoluetly fantastic, just wish it had more than 4 levels...
Love it, wanted it to be longer and the submarine level is more of a roomscale level, with only 2 sensors you will get some touch juddering.
I had a friend on the couch watching and we had so much fun. One person plays in the rift while the other tries to help watching the TV (in my setup). Had a blast - we rotated every other puzzle.
it's a really good game, no doubt. But you can beat it in a couple of hours not more. if you are good enough you can finish the game in less than an hour.

review_title: Quite fun, but way too short
one_reviews_text: Finished it in less than 2 hours, and the replay value is quite low
This game really nails point and click game style gameplay in vr. It's just not long enough. That's the only downside.
A bit short but loads of fun. The feeling you get when you start getting hopeless and then solve the puzzle is amazing. Definetly worth the money.

review_title: Great game, just a bit short.
one_reviews_text: Great game very fun, but as others have mentioned it could really use some more levels.
The tone of this is just right and it made me giggle on more than one occasion. Needs a few more missions (DLC?) but still a must for touch owners.

This game nails everything and i want more! There are only 4 levels so far that are all great and very challenging. Great humor, great puzzles, great art work and level design. PLEASE MAKE MORE CONTENT!!!

review_title: One of the best experiences available
one_reviews_text: This is a very charming game with a great asthetic. It's witty and easy for anyone to get into.

review_title: Fun, can't figure out the last level
one_reviews_text: This game is really fun and a good use of VR. You need patience though and it requires some quick thinking at times. I've been stuck at the last level...no idea how to finish it.
Game had me giggling to myself with its "Get Smart" like take on the spy world. Very good narration delivered in a corny 90's spy tv show fashion. I loved it
Super fun, just done and over with very quickly.....some challenges after if you're a perfectionist, but they dont add much
I was looking forward to playing this game on the oculus. Its definitely a a fun time, I hope more missions come out soon! If I learned anything from 007 movies, theres never only one villian.
Great game that is really fun and engaging. Puzzle are just the right difficulty to not put off someone while also being really fun and challenging.
I purchase a lot of games, and this is most definitely on the top of my list! Very well thought through, very interesting, and constantly unique!
Fairly Short, but well worth the money, wish they had much more then currently is here as the premise is brilliant and the wife loves it!
Probably the most enjoyable game I've played on Rift so far. It was fun with a controller but is amazing with the Touch.
This is my favorite VR game so far. very fun and funny.
Worth a play through.
but if you hurry you can kill it under 3 hours
This is the best Touch seated game right now. It's a bit short but that's made up by the amazing polish and atmosphere.

An absolute blast.  
Art design is great.  Right mix of commedy and death.
